articles.title: DPRK Premier Inspects Flood-hit Areas in S. Hwanghae Province
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Inspects Flood-hit Areas in S. Hwanghae Province 
						

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim inspected the flood-hit areas of South Hwanghae Province on the spot. 
					
					 He visited flood-stricken areas including Chongjong-ri and Simphyong-ri of Chongdan County before holding a consultative meeting. 
					
					 The meeting discussed on the issue of rehabilitating the destroyed reservoirs and facilities and inundated farm land in the province and underscored the need for commissions, ministries and national institutions to bring the living of the population in the afflicted areas to normal as soon as possible. 
					
					 Earlier, the premier toured the Unha and Kumdang co-op farms in Onchon County and other places and called for increasing grain yield by putting farming on a scientific and technical basis as required by the Juche farming method.

articles.title: Greetings to Macedonian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Macedonian President 

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Gjorgje Ivanov, president of Macedonia, on its national day.
					
					Kim in the message extended congratulations to the President of Macedonia and wished its people prosperity and progress.

articles.title: Greetings to Macedonian FM
articles.content:
Greetings to Macedonian FM
						

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- Pak Ui Chun, foreign minister of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Nikola Poposki, foreign minister of Macedonia, on its national day.
					
					 In the message he expressed belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would develop on good terms by joint efforts.

articles.title: Nepali Party Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
Nepali Party Delegation Arrives 

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist) headed by Darmendra Raj Bastala, member of the Political Bureau of the Party Central Committee and chairman of its Western Regional Committee, arrived here on Tuesday.

articles.title: Flotilla of Exercise Warships of Navy of CPLA to Visit DPRK
articles.content:
Flotilla of Exercise Warships of Navy of CPLA to Visit DPRK
						

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- A flotilla of exercise warships of the Navy of the Chinese People's Liberation Army (CPLA) headed by Vice Admiral Tian Zhong, commander of the North Sea Fleet of the Navy of the CPLA, will pay a goodwill visit to the DPRK from Aug. 4 to 8 on the 50th anniversary of the conclusion of the DPRK-China treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance. The flotilla consists of the exercise warship "Zheng He" and the escort warship "Luo Yang".

articles.title: Friendship Meeting with Russians Held
articles.content:
Friendship Meeting with Russians Held

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- A friendship meeting with Russians took place at the Volleyball Gymnasium in Chongchun Street here on Tuesday to mark the 10th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's historic visit to the Russian Federation and the adoption of the DPRK-Russia Moscow Declaration. 
					
					 Present at the meeting were Mun Jae Chol, vice-chairman of the Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and chairman of the DPRK-Russia Friendship Association, officials concerned, artistes of the National Folk Art Troupe and Ambassador Valery Sukhinin and staff members of the Russian embassy here and a delegation of the Russkiy Mir Foundation of Russia. 
					
					 The participants enjoyed a performance by artistes of the National Folk Art Troupe. 
					
					 They talked to each other about the need to further develop the friendship forged by the leaders of the two countries and played colorful sports and amusement games, deepening friendly feelings.

articles.title: Plenary Meeting of Youth League Held
articles.content:
Plenary Meeting of Youth League Held

					Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- The 45th plenary meeting of the C.C., Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League took place in Pyongyang on Tuesday. 
					
					 The meeting discussed the tasks for its organizations to prepare school youth and children as reliable heirs to the Songun revolution and make the young people fully display the honor of being youth vanguard in the work for renovating major objects. 
					
					 Ri Yong Chol, first secretary of the C.C., the youth league, made a report at the meeting, which was followed by speeches.

articles.title: New Postage Stamps Issued
articles.content:
New Postage Stamps Issued

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- The DPRK State Stamp Bureau recently issued new stamps as regards the UN declaration of this year as International Year of Chemistry and International Year of Forests.
					
					 The stamps include an individual stamp and a sheet.
					
					 Seen in the upper part of the stamps are Korean and English letters "International Year of Chemistry 2011" and "International Year of Forests 2011", as well as emblems symbolic of the themes. 
					
					 The individual stamp contains photos of Dr. Ri Sung Gi, a Korean scientist who invented vinylon, and Curie Marie, a Nobel laureate who discovered radioelements. 
					
					 The sheet carries a picture of schoolchildren planting trees.
					
					 The State Stamp Bureau also issued a sheetlet with pictures of cactuses growing in different countries.

articles.title: Consumer Goods Production Campaign Gains Momentum
articles.content:
Consumer Goods Production Campaign Gains Momentum

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- The campaign to produce August 3 consumer goods in the DPRK is paying off profusely in the on-going advance for a great surge in the efforts to build a thriving nation.
					
					Industrial establishments, industrial goods general stores, direct sales stores and other commercial service institutions across the country organized the said consumer goods producing units of various forms including housewives' workteams and reusable goods production workteams in conformity with specific conditions. The number of those units increased to more than 10,000 this year and the ranks of producers more than doubled as compared with that in the same period of last year.
					
					 Cities and counties have made an effective use of raw materials to suit the characteristics of localities, thus boosting the production of varieties of consumer goods 2.5 times this year as compared with that last year.
					
					 The said campaign now under way across the country is a mass movement for steadily increasing the production of consumer goods by tapping all reserves and possibilities without big investment of the state and pooling the wisdom and creative ingenuity of the masses. It is, therefore, playing an increasing role in the development of the light industry.
					
					 Officials and other working people in the field of light industry and consumer goods producers across the country are working hard to raise the level of specialization in the production of consumer goods favored by people and popular on world markets for their long tradition.

articles.title: Ryongjong Fish Propagated Nationwide
articles.content:
Ryongjong Fish Propagated Nationwide
						

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- Ryongjong fish has been propagated all over the DPRK.
					
					 The polyphagous fish, not sensitive to water quality, is very profitable in fish breeding.
					
					 It weighs two to six kilograms in two or three years under good water and feeding conditions. 
					
					In November last year, General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited the Ryongjong Fish Farm. He saw ponds teemed with a species of carp and acquainted himself with its specific features. Learning that the farm was the first to breed the fish in the country, he suggested calling it Ryongjong fish and propagating it nationwide.
					
					 Since then, a lot of Ryongjong fish spawning and breeding farms have been built in the country.
					
					 Having established a scientific seed fish cultivation and supply system, the Ryongjong Fish Farm has sent fries to many other fish farms this year. 
					
					 Ryongchon County, North Phyongan Province, has also bred some 100,000 fries and sent them to fish farms. 
					
					 Poman, Yomju, Yonggwang and many other fish farms throughout the country have begun to raise Ryongjong fish.

articles.title: Koreans Benefit from Telemedicine Service
articles.content:
Koreans Benefit from Telemedicine Service

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- The telemedicine service, which started in the DPRK in Juche 99 (2010), has proved successful. 
					
					 The telemedicine service makes it possible for able doctors to give correct diagnoses and therapies to way-off patients. 
					
					 Some time ago, a 12-year-old girl residing in South Phyongan Province benefited from the service. She, who had suffered from an intractable disease, had to have one of her legs cut off. But with the help of able doctors in Pyongyang, she recovered from the illness, with her leg left intact. 
					
					 The Ministry of Public Health plans to expand the telemedicine network throughout the country.
					
					 Communication infrastructure projects have been finished in many parts of the country.
					
					 The World Health Organization has paid attention to the DPRK's telemedicine service, supplying it with computers, laser printers, digital electrocardiographs, cameras for consultation and other equipment necessary for the service.

articles.title: Antiques of Ancient Greece from Cyprus
articles.content:
Antiques of Ancient Greece from Cyprus

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- A ceramic oil bottle and lamp are put on display at the International Friendship Exhibition House in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					
					 They are historical relics ancient Greek people used during their voyage.
					
					 One day in June Juche 58 (1969) the chairman of the Socialist Party of Cyprus met the Cyprian president ahead of his visit to Korea.
					
					 He told the president that he had long looked forward to visiting Korea and meeting President Kim Il Sung, who founded the Juche idea.
					
					 The Cyprian president was glad to hear that and suggested presenting Kim Il Sung with a ceramic oil bottle and lamp of ancient Greece preserved in a museum.
					
					 The relics were so precious that it was not allowed to take picture of them and take them away from the country. 
					
					 The president said it would be good to present the precious antiques to Kim Il Sung in the name of the Cyprian people.
					
					 When receiving the gift from the visiting chairman, Kim Il Sung expressed thanks to him for the valuable gift.
					
					 The chairman told Kim Il Sung that he was very happy to be the first Cyprian to give pleasure to the DPRK President.

articles.title: Aircraft-Hunting Movement Created by Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Aircraft-Hunting Movement Created by Kim Il Sung

					Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- One day in the Fatherland Liberation War period, President Kim Il Sung ordered commanding officers of the Korean People's Army (KPA) to take measures to shoot down enemy planes with small arms since the country lacked anti-aircraft arms.
					
					 He told them rifles had been used to shoot down enemy planes during the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle and that such weapons as light and heavy machine guns were enough for aircraft hunting.
					
					 He issued an order of the KPA Supreme Commander "On Organizing Aircraft-Hunting Teams" in late December Juche 39 (1950). The order required most KPA units to launch aircraft-hunting activities.
					
					 Units of the KPA and People's Security Forces formed aircraft-hunting teams to bring many planes down with rifles, light and heavy machine guns and anti-tank guns.
					
					 They shot down nearly 3,000 planes in two years.
					
					 The aircraft-hunting activities foiled the U.S. "air supremacy" and "air strategy" and greatly contributed to winning the war.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Accuses Japan of Its Territorial Ambition
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Accuses Japan of Its Territorial Ambition 

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- Japan is running wilder to realize its ambition for territorial expansion.
					
					 It will reportedly hold an exhibition titled "Japan's Sea-Islets to be defended" in downtown Tokyo.
					
					 Similar exhibitions aimed to assert Japan's territorial claim to Tok Islets had been held within Shimane Prefecture before. This time Japan is set to hold it in Tokyo, openly displaying the diorama of the islets, their map and the paper permitting Japanese to tour them, moves betraying its wild territorial ambition.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that Japan does not hide the purpose of the exhibition, saying it is aimed to implant the territorial ambition into the Japanese. 
					
					 Recently the Japanese reactionaries kicked up a row, "protesting" against a south Korean passenger plane's test flight over Tok Islets. They banned Japanese officials' use of the plane and are mulling the Liberal Democratic Party assemblymen's visit to Ullung Island. These are interpreted as the moves to realize their territorial ambition.
					
					 By grabbing the islets the Japanese reactionaries seek to use them for staging a comeback to Korea and other Asian countries and monopolizing economic interests including aquatic and seabed resources abundant in waters off the islets.
					
					 It is for this purpose that Japan is imbuing its citizens and young people with the ambition to seize Tok Islets. The said exhibition is aimed to serve the same purpose. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' moves to grab the islets, inalienable parts of Korea's territory from historical, geographical and international legal points of view, are a wanton violation of the sovereignty of Korea and they can never be tolerated under any circumstances. 
					
					 Japan's disclosure of its ambition for territorial aggrandizement at a time when it is troubled with complicated domestic situation will only reveal its true colors as inveterate aggressor.
					
					 Japan had better drop its territorial claim, not forgetting the bitter lesson of defeat drawn from its past history of aggression.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Confrontation with Compatriots Flayed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Confrontation with Compatriots Flayed
						

					Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- South Korea's recent evermore undisguised moves to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK are a revelation of deep rooted hostility toward compatriots, Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in a bylined article.
					
					The confrontation with compatriots is a means of existence inherent to the group of traitors forsaken by the nation and its inveterate bad habit, the article says, and goes on:
					
					The present south Korean ruling forces are committing high treason putting all crimes perpetrated by the preceding forces against the country's reunification into the shade.
					
					The south Korean conservative group's madcap confrontation with compatriots betrays its sinister intention to justify and stick to the already bankrupt "policy toward the north".
					
					It is the trite method of the south Korean ruling forces to escalate the confrontation and tension between the north and the south to an extreme pitch whenever they find themselves in a crisis and thus divert the public attention elsewhere. 
					
					With no gimmick, however, can they justify their policy of confrontation or escape their miserable fate.
					
					When looking back on history, the policy pursued quite contrary to the trend of the times and the public mind-set is bound to go bust and those dictators who put it into force could not get rid of the graveyard of history, cursed and denounced by the people. The fate of the present south Korean ruling forces cannot be otherwise.

articles.title: Minju Joson Blasts Japanese Reactionaries' Planned Introduction of Early Warning Satellite
articles.content:
Minju Joson Blasts Japanese Reactionaries' Planned Introduction of Early Warning Satellite 

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- It was reported that the Japanese government on July 9 started the examination of the introduction of U.S.-made early warning satellite capable of detecting ballistic missile launch. The funds for its introduction will reportedly be included in the budget for fiscal year 2012. 
					
					 In this regard, those concerned of the Japanese government are floating the story that the satellite introduction is aimed at preventing disasters such as forest fires caused by the massive earthquake that hit East Japan. 
					
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard: 
					
					 This is nothing but a poor farce to calm down the international community's caution against Japan.
					
					 It is a sheer lie that Japan is set to introduce such expensive high-tech satellite for fear of forest fires and other disasters. What Japan seeks is not to prevent disasters but to gain military supremacy in the space field. 
					
					 Spurs being put by Japan to bolstering its military muscle under the absurd pretence are to turn Japan into a military giant at an early date and round off the military preparations for realizing its ambition for overseas aggression. 
					
					 The above-said move of Japan is now posing great danger to the security in Asia. 
					
					 The world should not remain a passive onlooker to this grave situation prevailing in Asia.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Ideological and Theoretical Exploits of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Ideological and Theoretical Exploits of Kim Il Sung

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung clarified the essence of the world revolution and the law governing its development from a new angle and, on this basis, expounded original ideas and theories on making the whole world independent.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 It goes on: 
					
					 He newly clarified the essence of the world revolution with main emphasis on independence, the life and soul of human being as a social being. This helped clearly explain the fact that the ultimate goal of the world revolution is to fully realize the independence of the popular masses worldwide and roundly expose the absurdity and injustice of sophism of the modern revisionists and their mouthpieces that advocated compromise with imperialism, talking about "priority to the value of the whole mankind" and "community linked by the common destiny."
					
					 The President made a scientific formulation for the first time in history that the struggle for making the whole world independent means, in essence, establishing international relations based on independence and democratizing the international community. He, at the same time, lucidly explained that making the whole world independent is a common task facing the world people in our times.
					
					 He also clarified that the driving force for the world revolution is the world people advocating independence and they comprise all the anti-imperialist independent forces advocating independence against imperialism and hegemony including the socialist countries, national liberation movement in colonies, the Non-Aligned Movement and the world peace movement. 
					
					 He explained from a new angle that imperialism and hegemony going against the trend of the present times towards independence are the world people's common targets of struggle and the main targets of the world revolution. The main strategy of the world revolution and principled issues and ways for carrying it out comprehensively indicated by the President made it possible to formulate a scientific strategy and tactics for winning the victory of the world revolution and for it to take the road of fresh great surge.

articles.title: Suppression of Media Persons Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Suppression of Media Persons Protested in S. Korea

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- The Internet Journalists Association of south Korea in a statement on July 27 denounced the Intelligence Service for its crackdown on press activities for reunification.
					
					 The IS searched the house and office of the chief editor of magazine Minjok 21, claiming that he was "involved in the Iljin Association under instructions of the north," the statement said.
					
					 Since its birth the magazine has conducted legitimate press activities for peaceful reunification of the south and the north in the spirit of national reconciliation and cooperation, it noted.
					
					 The recent suppression is a planned and unprecedented deed of seriously violating freedom of speech, the statement charged.
					
					 Accusations against the IS's crackdown on media are growing stronger from among different circles, it said, demanding that the authorities stop at once such moves of violating the rights of media organizations and journalists.

articles.title: S. Korean "Government" Urged to Save North-related Businesses
articles.content:
S. Korean "Government" Urged to Save North-related Businesses 
						

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hankuk Ilbo carried an article titled "For Saving Companies Facing Crisis in Business with North" on July 22.
					
					 South Korean companies facing a crisis in business with the north due to the interrupted Mt. Kumgang tourism and the "May 24 measure" agreed to take a joint action, the newspaper said, adding:
					
					They are contemplating such actions as suing the Unification Ministry for damages, paying a protest visit and returning business licenses to the ministry and staging demonstrations.
					
					 Some of the companies already claimed damages but it is the first time for them to take a joint action. So, its effect is likely to be serious.
					
					 In the wake of the interruption of the Mt. Kumgang tourism, south-north economic cooperation projects and trade were totally suspended, except the Kaesong Industrial Zone, by the measure taken on May 24 last year. The related companies are heavily suffering from the measure, many of them being on the brink of bankruptcy for lack of money. 
					
					 They are now demanding compensation for damages. 
					
					 They made investments in the projects with confidence in the government's north policy. The government, responsible for the people's life and property, should provide them with conditions necessary for their business and take care of them.
					
					 First of all, the government should take a long-range view and save the companies engaging in south-north economic cooperation projects from a crisis to invigorate them.

articles.title: US Urged to Conclude Peace Treaty with DPRK--Swedish Personages
articles.content:
US Urged to Conclude Peace Treaty with DPRK--Swedish Personages
						

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- Personages of Sweden on July 25 issued statements to mark the 58th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 The Korean Armistice Agreement was signed on July 27, 1953, Eric Andersson, international secretary of the Communist Party, noted, saying: This agreement has so far existed between the DPRK and the U.S. and there has continued on the Korean Peninsula the dangerous situation under which another war may break out anytime.
					
					 The KAA has already long forfeited its mission and role as an institutional mechanism deterring tension and danger of war in the peninsula, he said, and went on:
					
					 This agreement should be replaced with a peace treaty in order to ensure peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world.
					
					 The U.S. should come out for concluding a peace treaty without delay.
					
					 Christer Lundgren, chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association, noted that after the ceasefire the U.S. has constantly threatened the DPRK, aggravating the military tension on the peninsula.
					
					 The U.S. aggressive policy for confrontation poses a serious threat to not only the Korean people but also the world progressives and global peace, he said.
					
					 The progressive mankind is strongly urging the U.S. to conclude a peace treaty with the DPRK, he stressed.

articles.title: Belorussian Organization Hits US for Aggression on DPRK
articles.content:
Belorussian Organization Hits US for Aggression on DPRK

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- The Social Federation "For the Union and Union's Communist Party" of Belarus issued a statement on July 21 to mark the 58th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 The United States instigated the south Korean puppet forces to ignite a war of aggression on the DPRK on June 25, 1950, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 What the U.S. sought was to stifle the DPRK, dominate the whole Korean Peninsula and put the world under its control with the DPRK as a springboard.
					
					 But the U.S. could not attain its aims due to the heroic resistance of the Korean people and was compelled to sign the armistice agreement.
					
					 The military adventure of the U.S., which inflicted big sacrifice and sufferings on the Koreans, met a disgraceful end on July 27, 1953.
					
					 The U.S. is still keeping its troops armed with nukes in south Korea while constantly committing military provocations.
					
					 It has also turned aside the just stand of the DPRK for denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula and its durable peace and independent and peaceful reunification.
					
					 The peninsula is becoming an ignition point of a new world war due to the U.S. machinations.
					
					 The U.S. is hell-bent on the military intervention in the DPRK and other countries, oblivious of the lesson it drew from the defeat in the Korean War.
					
					 On the occasion of the war victory day we reaffirm our invariable support and solidarity with the Korean people.

articles.title: Media of Various Countries Mark War Victory Day of DPRK
articles.content:
Media of Various Countries Mark War Victory Day of DPRK

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- Media of different countries gave special write-ups and made commemorative reports between July 24 and 27 to mark the 58th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 The Uruguayan paper La Juventud carried an article titled "President Kim Il Sung, extraordinary strategist" with a portrait of the smiling President and a photo of his revolutionary activity.
					
					 The article introduced the military leadership feats of the President, saying that the Korean people's victory in the war against the U.S. imperialists' armed invasion would have been unthinkable without him.
					
					 The Iranian paper Iran News said in an article entitled "President Kim Il Sung's feats for victory in the war" it was entirely thanks to the President's rare commanding art that the Korean people could defeat the U.S. in the war.
					
					 His ever-changing and flexible peculiar military tactics and bold and superb command forced the U.S. with huge troops and military equipment to kneel down before the Korean people.
					
					 The Lao paper Congtap Pasason Lao carried a photo of the President finding himself among soldiers and an article praising the feats performed by him who brought about the beginning of decline for the U.S. imperialists with his unique military idea, strategy and tactics. 
					
					 This country's state radio, too, reported the same contents.

articles.title: War Victory Day of Korean People Marked by Ecuadorian Organization
articles.content:
War Victory Day of Korean People Marked by Ecuadorian Organization
						

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- The Ecuadorian Preparatory Committee for Commemorating the Centenary of Birth of President Kim Il Sung on July 25 issued a bulletin on the 58th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 The bulletin in an article said that President Kim Il Sung led the war to victory and the U.S. imperialists could not but sign the armistice agreement after suffering a disgraceful defeat.
					
					 The DPRK has striven to replace the armistice agreement with a peace treaty but the U.S. has turned aside this while intensifying, in league with the south Korean authorities, the anti-DPRK moves to aggravate the situation on the Korean Peninsula, it noted.
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il has shattered the anti-DPRK moves of the U.S. and the south Korean authorities with his Songun politics to reliably defend the sovereignty of the country and the socialist system, it stated.
					
					 A peace treaty should be concluded between the DPRK and the U.S., the bulletin said, calling upon the world progressives to further strengthen the solidarity movement demanding the U.S. troop pullout from south Korea and supporting the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea.

articles.title: War Victory Day of DPRK Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
War Victory Day of DPRK Celebrated Abroad

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- Seminars were held in France and Britain on July 23 to mark the 58th anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 Jean Marie Lambret, chief of the French Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Idea, said in his report that President Kim Il Sung, ever-victorious and iron-willed commander and gifted strategist, defeated the U.S. imperialists with the politico-ideological advantages of the army and people based on the original Songun idea.
					
					 His military idea is an original man-centered idea that makes it possible to settle all the issues arising in military affairs on the basis of man's position and role, the reporter said, adding:
					
					 His love and trust in the army and people was a major ideological and moral source that encouraged them to the struggle for safeguarding the country. This was also the decisive guarantee for the victory in the war.
					
					 Dermot Hudson, chairman of the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, and other speakers said that the Korean people's brilliant victory in the Fatherland Liberation War was thanks to the President's distinguished military idea, commanding art and Juche-oriented war methods.
					
					 This victory showed that any country is fully capable of defeating the formidable imperialism if all the people get closely united under the guidance of the great leader, they stressed.

articles.title: China Offers Food Aid to African Nations
articles.content:
China Offers Food Aid to African Nations

					 Beijing, August 1 (KCNA) -- A Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman, Ma Zhaoxu, Friday announced the Chinese government decided to provide 90 million yuan (14mln U.S. dollars) worth of emergency food assistance to drought-hit regions of Africa.
					
					 He said China is deeply concerned with the widespread famine triggered by the severe drought in African regions.
					
					 "Our heartfelt sympathy goes out to all the drought victims," he added in a written statement.

articles.title: China Intensifies Military Drills with Other Countries
articles.content:
China Intensifies Military Drills with Other Countries

					 Beijing, August 1 (KCNA) -- China has staged 50 joint military drills with 28 countries from the year 2002, said a senior official of the Foreign Affairs Office of the Chinese Ministry of Defense on July 29. 
					
					 Through the drills China sought to use its armed forces for peaceful purposes, the official said. The drills contributed to developing relations and friendship between the Chinese and foreign armies and upgrading the level of the Chinese army's exercises.

articles.title: China's State Council Calls for Preventing Accidents
articles.content:
China's State Council Calls for Preventing Accidents

					 Beijing, August 1 (KCNA) -- A committee of China's State Council issued a notice calling for preventing large-scale accidents in all regions and sectors.
					
					 The notice expressed deep concern about large-scale accidents which occurred one after another in the country in July, and underscored the need for all regions to take effective measures to prevent accidents.

articles.title: China to Strengthen Education in Defense
articles.content:
China to Strengthen Education in Defense
						

					 Beijing, August 1 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Communist Party, the State Council and the Central Military Commission of China recently issued an opinion on strengthening education in defense under the new situation.
					
					 The opinion underlined the need to apply the law on education in defense in an overall way, give full play to patriotism and enhance the all-people conception of defense and thus promote construction and consolidate the national defense.
					
					 To strengthen education in defense is a common duty of the whole party and society, it said, urging the party committees and governments at all levels to attach importance to this work and properly organize supervision and inspection of the implementation of the law on education in defense.

articles.title: Chinese Warships Arrive in Vladivostok
articles.content:
Chinese Warships Arrive in Vladivostok 
						

					 Moscow, August 1 (KCNA) -- The training ship Zheng He and the frigate Luoyang of China arrived in Vladivostok, Russia on Friday. 
					
					 Chinese sailors stay in Vladivostok till Tuesday.
					
					 During the stay, Chinese and Russian sailors attend the celebrations of the Russian Navy Day, including sporting events and sightseeing in scenic spots.    
					
					 The Chinese sailors' visit to Vladivostok is viewed as a symbol of the developing neighborly relations between China and Russia.

articles.title: China Rejects Vatican's Threat
articles.content:
China Rejects Vatican's Threat
						

					 Beijing, August 1 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the State Administration for Religious Affairs of China rejected the Vatican's threat to the Chinese Catholic Church.
					
					 The Vatican threatened to punish the Chinese Catholic Church for having ordained two bishops without permission.
					
					 In a press statement, the spokesman described the threat as impolite and rude.
					
					 It seriously hurt the Chinese Catholic Church and believers, said the statement.

articles.title: National Unity Should Be Defended: Chinese Official
articles.content:
National Unity Should Be Defended: Chinese Official
						

					 Beijing, August 1 (KCNA) -- Meng Jianzhu, minister of Public Security of China, called upon the security organs to defend national unity and promote the harmony of society. 
					
					 During his recent inspection tour of the Ninxia Hui Autonomous Region, he said the mass work should be done well in regions of the country because it is of weighty significance in boosting national unity and concord and defending social harmony and stability. 
					
					 To this end, the security organs should carry forward the excellent tradition of keeping in close touch with people and steadily improve their working ability, he added.

articles.title: Russian President Congratulates Sailors, War Veterans
articles.content:
Russian President Congratulates Sailors, War Veterans 

					 Moscow, August 1 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev Sunday congratulated the country's sailors and war veterans on the Russian Navy Day.
					
					 Addressing a celebration, he said the navy is an inseparable, reliable part of national defense.
					
					 The sailors' will to ensure the security of the country makes Russia steadily advance forward and successfully develop, he added.

articles.title: Russia Warns of US Sanction
articles.content:
Russia Warns of US Sanction

					Moscow, August 1 (KCNA) -- The Russian Foreign Ministry in a recent statement criticized the U.S. State Department for attempting to apply a visa restriction to some Russian officials over the death of a lawyer during investigation in Russia.
					
					The statement said the attempt to interfere in Russian judicial agencies' investigation and put pressure on them is intolerable.
					
					Russia will never remain silent over the attempt, the statement warned.

articles.title: US Military Training Ground Returns to Okinawa
articles.content:
US Military Training Ground Returns to Okinawa

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- A U.S. military training ground was returned to Okinawa Prefecture, Japan on July 31, 54 years after the U.S. began to use it.
					
					 Whenever the U.S. Marine Corps practiced helicopter taking off and landing, local people reportedly suffered from noises and flare bombs.

articles.title: US Rural Areas Suffer from Lack of Doctors
articles.content:
US Rural Areas Suffer from Lack of Doctors

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- Rural areas of California, the U.S. are suffering from lack of doctors. 
					
					 More than 830,000 people in rural areas of California must travel over 100 kilometers to see doctors due to lack of health care in their areas. 
					
					 Many patients in rural areas are troubled with diabetes and heart problems, La Opinion daily reported on Friday.

articles.title: Unemployment Is Still Serious in US
articles.content:
Unemployment Is Still Serious in US
						

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- Unemployment still remains a serious issue in the United States due to the continued economic depression.
					
					The U.S. Labor Department said Thursday that the advance figure for seasonally adjusted initial claims for jobless benefits was 398,000 in the week ending July 23.

articles.title: Japan Extends SDF Peacekeeping Mission in Golan Heights for Half Year
articles.content:
Japan Extends SDF Peacekeeping Mission in Golan Heights for Half Year

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- The authorities of Japan persistently seek to keep the overseas presence of troops of its "Self-Defense Forces" for a long time.
					
					 The Japanese government decided at a Cabinet meeting on July 29 to extend the "SDF" U.N. peacekeeping operations in the Golan Heights for another six months through March 31 next year.

articles.title: Japan's Electric Goods Manufacturing Enterprises Suffer Fabulous Losses
articles.content:
Japan's Electric Goods Manufacturing Enterprises Suffer Fabulous Losses 
						

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- Electric goods manufacturing enterprises of Japan are suffering fabulous losses due to serious depression.
					
					 Panasonic Corp. said Thursday it fell into the red with a net group loss of 30.35 billion yen in the April-June quarter.
					
					 Sharp Corp., Fujitsu Ltd. and Sony Corp. recorded a group net loss of 49.28 billion yen, 20.4 billion yen and 15.50 billion yen in the April-June period.

articles.title: Peruvian President on Tasks of New Government
articles.content:
Peruvian President on Tasks of New Government
						

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- Peruvian President Ollanta Humala referred to the tasks of the new government in his inaugural speech on July 28.
					
					 He said that the government would develop health and education, provide inhabitants with more jobs and ensure social equality.
					
					 He also vowed to strengthen friendly relations and economic cooperation with various countries and strive to push forward the regional integration in particular.

articles.title: Palestinians Reject Israel's Misinformation
articles.content:
Palestinians Reject Israel's Misinformation 
						

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- A senior Palestinian official Friday denied reports saying that the Palestinians have resumed the peace negotiations with Israel.
					
					 On Friday, the Israeli Haaretz Daily reported that Israeli President Shimon Peres is holding intensive secret talks with the Palestinians in a bid to resume the peace talks.
					
					 The Israeli reports on peace talks "are not true at all," Nabil Abu Rdeineh, spokesman of the Palestinian presidency, said in a statement carried by the state Wafa news agency.
					
					 "Any talks with Israel must be based on the borders of 1967, comprehensive cessation of settlement and to accept the international legitimacy," said Abu Rdeineh.

articles.title: Israel Tests Missile Defense System
articles.content:
Israel Tests Missile Defense System
						

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- Israel tested a new missile defense system on July 28.
					
					 The test was conducted to intercept a mock ballistic missile by using a defense missile system Israel is jointly developing with the U.S.
					
					 This is sparking off great worries of the international community as one more challenge threatening the peace and security in the Mideast region.

articles.title: Sectors of Cuba Fulfill Their First Half-Yearly Plans
articles.content:
Sectors of Cuba Fulfill Their First Half-Yearly Plans

					 Havana, August 1 (KCNA) -- The agricultural field of Cuba successfully carried out its first half-yearly quota, according to a recent report of the government.
					
					 Production of chicken, egg, coffee, tobacco, etc., in particular, increased during the period.
					
					 The economic plans were over-fulfilled in commerce and timber production fields, too.

articles.title: Economic Confidence Declines in Eurozone
articles.content:
Economic Confidence Declines in Eurozone
						

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- Economic confidence in the eurozone declined for the fifth consecutive month in July, the European Commission said on July 28.
					
					 The economic sentiment indicator (ESI) for the 17-nation bloc sharing the euro fell by 2.2 points to 103.2, while the monthly indicator, based on business and consumer surveys, also dropped by 2.2 points to 102.4 in the European Union.

articles.title: Cooperation among Different Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Different Countries

					 Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- Mongolia and India agreed Thursday to strengthen bilateral cooperation in nuclear energy and mining.
					
					 Cambodia and Malaysia on the same day pledged to strengthen cooperation in the military field. 
					
					 On Wednesday Mexico and Guatemala agreed to cooperate with each other in the work to ensure the security in the border region of the two countries.

articles.title: RPDC sufre pérdidas humanas y materiales por tifón e inundaciones
articles.content:
RPDC sufre pérdidas humanas y materiales por tifón e inundaciones
						

					Pyongyang, 1 de agosto (ACNC) -- Entre la tercera década de junio y la segunda de julio, en la República Popular Democrática de Corea el tifón 5 e inundaciones ocasionaron decenas de muertos, heridos y desaparecidos.
					
					Solo en la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur quedaron destruidas más de 2 mil 2 cientos de viviendas y en escala nacional, más de 2 mil 900, debido a lo cual, más de 8 mil habitantes viven en las instalaciones provisionales.
					
					Sobre todo, cerca de 60 mil hectáreas de las tierras cultivables quedaron sumergidas o pérdidas, lo cual ejercerá gran influencia negativa a la producción de cereales de este año.
					
					También quedaron arruinados más de 170 edificios de producción y públicos y cortados las carreteras y puentes por el derrumbe de montes y muros de contención, lo cual crea dificultades a eliminar los daños. Una torre de hierro de alta tensión y más de tres cientos de postes eléctricos cayeron al suelo, lo cual paralizó la suministración de electricidad.
					
					Además, cayeron más de 8 mil 400 árboles de bordes de calles.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim averigua daños por inundaciones y situación agrícola
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim averigua daños por inundaciones y situación agrícola 
						

					Pyongyang, 2 de agosto (ACNC) -- El primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros, Choe Yong Rim, averiguó en el mismo lugar las pérdidas por inundaciones de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur. 
					
					Convocó una reunión consultiva tras recorrer las comunas de Chongjong y Simphyong del distrito de Chongdan y otras zonas damnificadas. 
					
					En la cita se abordaron los temas de recuperar las represas y establecimientos destruidos y las tierras cultivables inundadas, tomar las medidas los comités, ministerios y órganos centrales para estabilizar cuanto antes la vida de los habitantes de las zonas damnificadas. 
					
					Con anterioridad, el premier recorrió las granjas cooperativas de Unha y Kumdang del distrito de Onchon y otros lugares, y apuntó la necesidad de hacer las faenas agrícolas de manera científica y técnica y de acuerdo con las exigencias del método de cultivo jucheano para aumentar el rendimiento de cereales.

articles.title: Pasa límite la ambición territorial de Japón, comenta la ACNC
articles.content:
Pasa límite la ambición territorial de Japón, comenta la ACNC
						

					Pyongyang, 2 de agosto (ACNC) -- En estos días, Japón se acalora más que nunca en la expansión territorial.
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses montan abiertamente en Tokio una exposición intitulada "Mar de Japón-islas que debemos defender" para insistir en la soberanía sobre el islote Tok.
					
					Ellos exponen  allí  la maqueta y el mapa del islote Tok, y hasta la licencia de viaje al islote, lo que muestra la infinita ambición territorial de este país isleño.
					
					Lo cuestionable es que Japón dice abiertamente que este certamen es para dar a habitantes japoneses la noción sobre el territorio. 
					
					Hace poco, los reaccionarios japoneses protestaron del vuelo de prueba sobre el islote Tok de un avión de pasajeros del Sur de Corea, toman las medidas de prohibición de uso del avión surcoreano de los funcionarios japoneses e intentan organizar la visita de los parlamentarios del Partido Democrático Liberal a la isla Ullung.
					
					Al ocupar el islote Tok, los reaccionarios japoneses persiguen usarlo como trampolín para agredir de nuevo a la RPDC y los países asiáticos y monopolizar la concesión económica de los recursos marítimos y submarinos de su contorno.
					
					Para este fin, ellos inspiran de modo sistemático a los habitantes, jóvenes y niños japoneses la conciencia de arrebato del islote Tok y la presente exhibición.
					
					Histórica y geográficamente y por la ley internacional, la campaña de arrebato de los reaccionarios japoneses sobre el islote Tok, tierra típica de la nación coreana, es la violación grosera a la soberanía de Corea.
					
					A medida que Japón muestra la ambición de expansión territorial en el momento muy complicado de su país como ahora, esto demostrará sólo su naturaleza agresiva.
					
					El país isleño no debe olvidarse de la lección de amarga derrota del pasado y abandonar su ambición de expandir el territorio.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia campaña conflictiva del Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia campaña conflictiva del Sur de Corea
						

					Pyongyang, 2 de agosto (ACNC) -- La cada vez más abierta campaña conflictiva en el Sur de Corea contra la República Popular Democrática de Corea, parte de la arraigada conciencia hostil a los connacionales.
					
					Así señala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un artículo individual difundido este martes y continúa.
					
					La confrontación fratricida es la costumbre fisiológica de la banda de traidores a la nación. Las actuales fuerzas en "poder" cometen archi-crímenes que superan en este tipo a sus antecesores.
					
					También, la banda de los conservadores surcoreanos recurre a tal campaña para justificar y ejecutar su "política sobre el Norte" ya fracasada.
					
					Cada vez que los gobernantes surcoreanos se hallan en una crisis, agravan al extremo la confrontación y la tensión con el Norte para desviar la opinión pública, lo cual es el método predilecto de ellos.
					
					Pero, con ningún maquiavelismo pueden justificar su política conflictiva en fracaso ni salvar su destino.
					
					Históricamente, la política en contrapelo de la corriente de la época y la opinión pública, no evitó el destino de fracaso y los dictadores, que la ejecutaron, eran objetos de la censura y la condenación  de los habitantes. Tampoco las actuales fuerzas en poder pueden evitar tal destino.
